New Records: This is Pakistan's highest T20 World Cup score against South Africa.
Shaheen Shah Afridi reached 50 T20I wickets.
Shadab Khan scored his first T20I half-century and Pakistan's second-fastest in T20Is.
Key Match Events: Iftikhar Ahmed and Shadab Khan scored half-centuries to get Pakistan to a competitive score.
Shaheen Shah Afridi dismissed Quinton de Kock and Rilee Rossouw cheaply.
Shadab Khan found Temba Bavuma's edge and dismissed Aiden Markram in quick succession.
Naseem Shah delivered a fantastic death over, getting rid of Tristan Stubbs.
South Africa needed 75 runs off the remaining five overs after the rain interruption.
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan needed to win to keep their semi-final hopes alive.
South Africa needed to beat Netherlands to keep their fate in their own hands.
Temba Bavuma acknowledged his poor form but expressed confidence in his team.
South Africa made two changes: Heinrich Klaasen replaced David Miller, and Tabraiz Shamsi replaced Keshav Maharaj.
Pakistan's Mohammad Haris replaced Fakhar Zaman due to injury.
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan kept their semi-final hopes alive with the victory.
South Africa remained second on the points table and needed to beat Netherlands to advance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was rain-reduced, affecting the chase.
South Africa's fielding was sloppy, dropping five catches.
The DLS method came into play due to rain interruptions.
The match was played on a chilly evening in Sydney.
